javadoc:
Uses Properties to manage user preferences as name/value pairs.  All methods
 are static.

methods.javadoc: Don't allow instantiation of this class.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Don't allow instantiation of this class.

methods.name: load
methods.comment: Initialize properties by reading name, values from the given filename.

params.name: pathName
params.comment: name of preferences file to read in; could be null

throws.comment: if there is a problem reading the file

methods.javadoc:
Clears all properties in this Preferences object.

Warning: Save any changes pending before calling this method, as this call will erase any changes not written do disk via {@link #store()}
methods.name: clear
methods.comment:
Clears all properties in this Preferences object.
 
 Warning: Save any changes pending before calling this method, as this call will
 erase any changes not written do disk via #store()

methods.javadoc:
Gets an input stream to a file that is the same named file within a different 
 application version directory for this user. This method will search for an 
 alternate file based on the application version directories modification times 
 and will use the first matching file it finds.
@return a file input stream for an alternate file or null.
methods.name: getAlternateFileInputStream
methods.comment:
Gets an input stream to a file that is the same named file within a different 
 application version directory for this user. This method will search for an 
 alternate file based on the application version directories modification times 
 and will use the first matching file it finds.

return.comment: a file input stream for an alternate file or null.

methods.name: removeProperty
methods.comment: Removes the given preference from this preferences object.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the preference key to remove.

return.comment: the value that was stored with the given key.

methods.javadoc:
Get the property with the given name.

Note: all getProperty(...) methods will first check {@link System#getProperty(String)} for a value first. This allows users to override preferences from the command-line.
methods.name: getProperty
methods.comment:
Get the property with the given name.
 
 Note: all getProperty(...) methods will first check System#getProperty(String)
 for a value first.  This allows users to override preferences from the command-line.

methods.name: getProperty
methods.comment:
Get the property with the given name; if there is no property, return the defaultValue.
 
 Note: all getProperty(...) methods will first check System#getProperty(String)
 for a value first.  This allows users to override preferences from the command-line.

methods.name: getProperty
methods.comment:
Get the property with the given name; if there is no property, return the defaultValue.
 
 This version of getProperty will, when useHistoricalValue is true, look
 for the given preference value in the last used installation of the application.
 
 Note: all getProperty(...) methods will first check System#getProperty(String)
 for a value first.  This allows users to override preferences from the command-line.

params.name: name
params.comment: The name of the property for which to get a value

params.name: defaultValue
params.comment: The value to use if there is no value yet set for the given name

params.name: useHistoricalValue
params.comment:
True signals to check the last used application installation for a 
        value for the given name if that value has not yet been set.

return.comment:
the property with the given name; if there is no property,
         return the defaultValue.

methods.name: setProperty
methods.comment:
Set the property value.  If a null value is passed, then the property is removed from 
 this collection of preferences.

methods.javadoc:
Get an array of known property names.
@return if there are no properties, return a zero-length array
methods.name: getPropertyNames
methods.comment: Get an array of known property names.

return.comment: if there are no properties, return a zero-length array

methods.javadoc: Get the filename that will be used in the store() method.
methods.name: getFilename
methods.comment: Get the filename that will be used in the store() method.

methods.name: setFilename
methods.comment:
Set the filename so that when the store() method is called, the
 preferences are written to this file.

methods.javadoc:
Store the preferences in a file for the current filename.
@throws RuntimeException if the preferences filename was not set
methods.name: store
methods.comment: Store the preferences in a file for the current filename.

methods.javadoc:
Return the paths in the UserPluginPath property.
 Return zero length array if this property is not set.
methods.name: getPluginPaths
methods.comment:
Return the paths in the UserPluginPath property.
 Return zero length array if this property is not set.

methods.javadoc: Set the paths to be used as the UserPluginPath property.
methods.name: setPluginPaths
methods.comment: Set the paths to be used as the UserPluginPath property.

methods.javadoc:
Set the plugin path property.
@param pathProperty A string of paths separated by {@link File#pathSeparator} characters
methods.name: setPluginPathProperty

params.name: pathProperty
params.comment: A string of paths separated by File#pathSeparator characters

methods.javadoc:
Append path to the plugin path.
@param path the plugin path to add
methods.name: addPluginPath
methods.comment: Append path to the plugin path.

methods.javadoc:
Append paths to the plugin path.
@param paths the plugin paths to add
methods.name: addPluginPaths
methods.comment: Append paths to the plugin path.

name: Preferences
comment:
Uses Properties to manage user preferences as name/value pairs.  All methods
 are static.

fields.javadoc: The APPLICATION_PREFERENCES_FILENAME is the default name for the user preferences file. @see ghidra.framework.preferences.Preferences
fields.name: APPLICATION_PREFERENCES_FILENAME
fields.comment: The APPLICATION_PREFERENCES_FILENAME is the default name for the user preferences file.

fields.javadoc: Preference name of the user plugin path.
fields.name: USER_PLUGIN_PATH
fields.comment: Preference name of the user plugin path.

fields.javadoc: Preference name of the user plugin jar directory.
fields.name: USER_PLUGIN_JAR_DIRECTORY
fields.comment: Preference name of the user plugin jar directory.

fields.javadoc: Preference name for the last opened archive directory.
fields.name: LAST_OPENED_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORY
fields.comment: Preference name for the last opened archive directory.

fields.javadoc: Preference name for the project directory.
fields.name: PROJECT_DIRECTORY
fields.comment: Preference name for the project directory.

fields.javadoc: Preference name for import directory that was last accessed for tools.
fields.name: LAST_TOOL_IMPORT_DIRECTORY
fields.comment: Preference name for import directory that was last accessed for tools.

fields.javadoc: Preference name for export directory that was last accessed for tools.
fields.name: LAST_TOOL_EXPORT_DIRECTORY
fields.comment: Preference name for export directory that was last accessed for tools.

fields.javadoc: Preference name for directory last selected for creating a new project.
fields.name: LAST_NEW_PROJECT_DIRECTORY
fields.comment: Preference name for directory last selected for creating a new project.

fields.javadoc:
Preference name for the import directory that was last accessed for
 domain files.
fields.name: LAST_IMPORT_DIRECTORY
fields.comment:
Preference name for the import directory that was last accessed for
 domain files.

fields.javadoc: Preference name for the export directory that was last accessed.
fields.name: LAST_EXPORT_DIRECTORY
fields.comment: Preference name for the export directory that was last accessed.

fields.javadoc: The data storage for this class.
fields.name: properties
fields.comment: The data storage for this class.

fields.javadoc: Data storage that contains preferences data from a previous installation.
fields.name: previousProperties
fields.comment: Data storage that contains preferences data from a previous installation.
